dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S87 IS: Let's Get to Work Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of Florida introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to modify work requirements under the supplemental nutrition assistance program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Let's Get to Work Act of 2025.

subsection.text: Section 6(o) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting , or, in the case of a parent or other member of a household with responsibility for a dependent child, 6 months (consecutive or otherwise), before during which;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking clause (ii) and inserting the following:
in subparagraph (C), by inserting under 6 years of age before the semicolon at the end;
in subparagraph (G), by striking or at the end;
in subparagraph (H), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: responsible for a dependent individual; and
married to, and resides with, an individual who is in compliance with the requirements of paragraph (2).

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking (I) and inserting (H);
in subparagraph (C), by striking (G) and (I) and inserting (F) and (H);
in subparagraph (D), by striking (G) through (I) and inserting (F) through (H);
by redesignating subparagraphs (G) through (J) as subparagraphs (F) through (I), respectively; and
in subparagraph (F) (as so redesignated), by striking (C), (D),, (E), or (F) and inserting (C), (D), or (E).

subsection.text: Section 16(h)(1)(E)(ii)(I) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(h)(1)(E)(ii)(I)) is amended by striking 3-month period and inserting 3-month or 6-month period, as applicable,.

section.header: Work requirements for public housing and tenant-based rental assistance

subsection.text: Section 3 of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437a) is amended by adding at the end the following:
The requirements described in section 6(o) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)) shall apply with respect to any individual who—

paragraph.text: is a member of a family residing in a public housing dwelling; and
is not exempted from those requirements under paragraph (3) of such section.

subsection.text: Section 8(o) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437f(o)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The requirements described in section 6(o) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)) shall apply with respect to any individual who—

subparagraph.text: is a member of a family receiving tenant-based assistance; and
is not exempted from those requirements under paragraph (3) of such section.
